seo.title: YakShaver developer certifications
seo.description: Earn a YakShaver Developer Credly Badge for LinkedIn. The badge shows that you're a YakShaver certified developer!

featureItem.headline: Professional YakShaver Certification
featureItem.text: We recommend that each organization have a certified YakShaver Admin. Upon successful completion of the below steps, you will receive a badge and your organization will receive 50 credits (valued at $25).

pageBlocks.body:
### To get the YakShaver certification, we will ask you to set up YakShaver, have you read the best practices, and do a test Shave in which you answer some basic questions to verify your understanding.

1\. In your YakShaver portal, add a project called 'Northwind' and set the backlog to this public GitHub repo: [https://github.com/SSWConsulting/SSW.YakShaver.Playground](https://github.com/SSWConsulting/SSW.YakShaver.Playground)\


2\. Set up a Windows or Mac screenshot tool by following [the docs](https://yakshaver.ai/docs/recording-work-item-snipping-tool).\
Note: Professionals use the keyboard shortcuts to save time \


3\. Read the Shaving [best practices](https://yakshaver.ai/docs/user-mention-guidelines-in-work-item-descriptions).\
Normally you would do a Shave into the 

4\. Do a Shave into the 'Northwind' project. In your recording, explain to us:

* The project's location in the portal, and its backlog.
* How you have set up your screen capture tool, and where the videos will go after being recorded?
* Why you must verbally mention the destination project and why you can't just rely on the screen.\


5\. We will review your answers, and if successful you will receive an email with your badge.

6\. Accept and share the badge on LinkedIn.\
### That's it! Your organization will receive 50 YakShaver credits.
